thread.section_title: The Orange County Register - News Headlines : Entertainment
thread.title: Creepy makeovers: See theater pros transform three Register writers for Halloween
thread.title_full: Creepy makeovers: See theater pros transform three Register writers for Halloween

author: KAITLIN WRIGHT, SARAH de CRESCENZO AND KEITH SHARON
title: Creepy makeovers: See theater pros transform three Register writers for Halloween
text: Creepy makeovers: See theater pros transform three Register writers for Halloween Oct. 16, 2015 Updated 12:00 a.m. 1 of 47 Register staffers Sarah de Crescenzo, left, Keith Sharon and Kaitlin Wright are shown after makeup artists from Orange County theater troupes transformed them for Halloween. PHOTOS BY NICK AGRO, MINDY SCHAUER AND MARK RIGHTMIRE 1 of 47 In the spirit of Halloween, Kaitlin Wright was transformed from a writer into a dark fairy with the help of Fullerton College costume design students. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 With the help of costume design students Jessi Lowerre, left, and Melissa Meza, right, of Fullerton College, OC Register writer Kaitlin Wright goes hunting for the dream costume for Halloween at the Savers Thrift Store in Anaheim. PAUL RODRIGUEZ, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Costume design students Melissa Meza, left, and Jessi Lowerre rummage through racks of clothes at Savers Thrift Store in Anaheim as they piece together a fairy Halloween costume for writer Kaitlin Wright. PAUL RODRIGUEZ, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 OC Register writer Kaitlin Wright, center, holds a black dress up as costume design students Melissa Meza, left, and Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton College look to see how a belt looks. The three were shopping for a dream costume for Halloween and Savers Thrift Store in Anaheim. PAUL RODRIGUEZ, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright before Fullerton College costume design students Jessi Lowerre and Melissa Meza transform her into dark fairy. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaitlin Wright with some makeup applied on her way to being transformed into a fairy of sorts with the help of Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton and Melissa Meza of Whittier, both students at Fullerton College and skilled in makeup and theater. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaitlin Wright gets some of the beginning makeup applied on her way to being transformed into a fairy of sorts. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaitlin Wright gets some of the beginning makeup applied on her way to being transformed into a fairy of sorts. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Melissa Meza of Whittier, right, of Whittier, and a student at Fullerton College, draws a vine on the face of Kaitlin Wright as she is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton, right, of Whittier, and a student at Fullerton College, applies makeup on the lips of Kaitlin Wright as she is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright, center, is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts with the help of Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton, left, and Melissa Meza of Whittier, right, both students at Fullerton College and skilled in makeup and theater. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts with the help of Jessi Lowerre, left, of Fullerton and Melissa Meza, right, of Whittier, both students at Fullerton College and skilled in makeup and theater. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaitlin Wright nears the end of having makeup applied and being transformed into a fairy of sorts with the help of Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton and Melissa Meza of Whittier, both students at Fullerton College and skilled in makeup and theater. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaitlin Wright wears the final makeup and accessories without the costume as she is transformed into a fairy of sorts with the help of Jessi Lowerre of Fullerton and Melissa Meza of Whittier, both students at Fullerton College and skilled in makeup and theater. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Jessi Lowerre, left, of Fullerton and Melissa Meza, right, of Whittier, both students at Fullerton College used their costume and makeup skills to create a Halloween fairy costume for writer Kaitlin Wright. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts for Halloween. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts for Halloween. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright underwent a Halloween-inspired transformation into a dark fairy with the help of Fullerton College costume design students. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Writer Kaitlin Wright is transformed from a writer into a fairy of sorts for Halloween. MARK RIGHTMIRE, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Kaz Liput shows Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo some costume options among the many racks of get-ups at 3-D Theatricals, a theater company in Anaheim. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo considers accessorizing her turn-of-the-century-style costume, previously worn in 3-D Theatricals' production of “Hello, Dolly!”, with an ornate, wide-brimmed hat that ties under the chin. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Wig and hair designer Kat Senior-Scott, with 3-D Theatricals in Anaheim, twists Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo's hair into pin curls so her natural hair fits neatly under a styled wig. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Makeup designer Denice Paxton gives Sarah de Crescenzo light, pale makeup to mimic the style of the early 1900s at 3-D Theatricals in Anaheim. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Wig and hair designer Kat Senior-Scott adjusts reporter Sarah de Crescenzo's wig, intended to complement a turn-of-the-century look, at 3-D Theatricals in Anaheim. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo adjusts a faux pearl drop earring in a mirror at 3-D Theatricals in Anaheim. In addition to the pair of earrings, the turn-of-the-century costume, from the musical “Hello, Dolly!”, was accessorized with a black-and-white cameo brooch. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo poses for a photo at 3-D Theatricals in Anaheim in an early 1900s-style costume, wig and makeup. The costume was originally used in 3-D Theatricals' production of the musical "Hello, Dolly!". NICK AGRO , STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Makeup designer Denice Paxton uses dark colors to give reporter Sarah de Crescenzo a ghoulish turn-of-the-century look: the ghost of a Titanic passenger. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo has foundation lighter than her skin tone applied by makeup designer Denice Paxton to give a turn-of-the-century look. Paxton is part of the team at Anaheim theater company 3-D Theatricals. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Secondhand finds from Orange County thrift stores come together for a DIY version of a turn-of-the-century look. Purchased at the Goodwill store in Lake Forest: long blue button-down dress, full-length skirt with a patterned ruffle hem (tucked underneath the dress to give the silhouette more volume) and a pair of white granny boots with laces. Accessories, purchased at Upscale Resale in Laguna Hills, which benefits South County Outreach, include a pair of faux pearl drop earrings, a faux pearl and ribbon necklace and a vintage peach-and-ivory cameo brooch. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Register reporter Sarah de Crescenzo's turn-of-the-century look gets a ghoulish twist, transformed into the ghost of a wealthy Titanic passenger who perished with the ship. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Secondhand finds from Orange County thrift stores come together for a DIY version of a turn-of-the-century look. The floor-length beaded, chiffon gown was purchased at the Keepers side of the Goodwill store in Lake Forest; accessories, including a pair of faux pearl drop earrings, a faux pearl and ribbon necklace and a vintage peach-and-ivory cameo brooch, were purchased at the Upscale Rescale thrift store in Laguna Hills, which benefits the nonprofit hunger and homelessness prevention organization South County Outreach. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 A vintage cameo brooch purchased at Upscale Resale in Laguna Hills complements a beaded, chiffon dress purchased at the Keepers side of the Goodwill thrift store in Lake Forest. NICK AGRO, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Reporter Keith Sharon wears a face only a mother could love after South Coast Repertory makeup artist Gillian Woodson, in back, transforms him into Jacob Marley from "A Christmas Carol." MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Keith Sharon is all smiles before transforming into his favorite Halloween character, Jacob Marley, from "A Christmas Carol." MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 First, South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson applies an overall base coat of green makeup on reporter Keith Sharon. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson uses black creme makeup to outline areas where black makeup will be applied. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson uses black creme makeup to outline areas where black makeup will be applied MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson uses black creme makeup to outline areas where black makeup will be applied. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson lays out the tools of her trade while making Register Reporter Keith Sharon into character Jacob Marley, from "A Christmas Carol." MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Gillian Woodson applies white finishing powder to Keith Sharon's finished face to help protect and hold the makeup. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Gillian Woodson applies white finishing powder to Keith Sharon's finished face to help protect and hold the makeup. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Reporter Keith Sharon gets made up as his favorite character, Jacob Marley, from "A Christmas Carol" by South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Reporter Keith Sharon tops of his makeup with a wiry, gray, ponytailed wig, completing his Jacob Marley character. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Reporter Keith Sharon looks in the mirror after being made to look like Jacob Marley, from "A Christmas Carol" by South Coast Repertory makeup technician Gillian Woodson. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Makeup technician Gillian Woodson perserves her handiwork with a cellphone selfie with reporter Keith Sharon. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 47 Yikes. Reporter Keith Sharon gets into the Jacob Marley persona after his makeup is applied. He is missing one finishing touch: A wig of long, gray ponytailed hair. MINDY SCHAUER, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER Register staffers Sarah de Crescenzo, left, Keith Sharon and Kaitlin Wright are shown after makeup artists from Orange County theater troupes transformed them for Halloween. PHOTOS BY NICK AGRO, MINDY SCHAUER AND MARK RIGHTMIRE By KAITLIN WRIGHT, SARAH de CRESCENZO AND KEITH SHARON / STAFF WRITERS
